macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Plunge as Tech Stocks and Bitcoin Tumble
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 1.2% to 6,798.40, Dow dropped 1.2% to 48,908.72, and Nasdaq sank 1.6% to 22,540.59 amid falling tech stocks and a 10% Bitcoin plunge to $63,000. Qualcomm shares dropped 8.5% despite beating earnings, while McKesson surged 16.5% on strong results.

items.title: Bank of England and ECB Hold Interest Rates Steady
items.summary: London’s FTSE 100 dropped 0.9% after the Bank of England held rates steady, while France’s CAC 40 fell 0.3% and Germany’s DAX lost 0.5% following the European Central Bank's decision to stand pat.

items.title: Global Markets in Bloodbath with Tech Sector Fragile
items.summary: South Korea’s Kospi tumbled 3.9% with Samsung Electronics down 5.8%, as tech resembles 2021 decline; US Treasuries and dollar strengthen amid selloff fueled by soft labor data and AI displacement fears.

items.title: Alphabet Posts Record Profits but Stock Hammered
items.summary: Google reported record profits in its earnings, yet the stock was hit hard, contributing to broader market selling waves across equities.

items.title: Metals Crash and Crypto Altcoins Plunge 20%+
items.summary: Silver dropped 10% to $73, while Bitcoin fell 10% to $63,000 and altcoins suffered steeper losses of 20% or more in the ongoing market chaos.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Experiences Worst Day Since FTX Collapse with 17% Drop
items.summary: Bitcoin fell about 17% from Wednesday's 4 p.m. ET level to a low just above $60,000 on Thursday, marking its biggest one-day drop since the FTX collapse, before recovering over 3% to above $65,000. The selloff erased over half its value from an October peak of $126,272, amid volatility linked to MicroStrategy's $12B Q4 loss and concerns over Trump's Fed chair nominee.

items.title: Crypto Market Sees $2.1 Billion in Liquidations as Bitcoin Nears $60,000
items.summary: Over $2.12 billion in cryptocurrency positions were liquidated amid Bitcoin's spiral toward $60,000 during the market bloodbath on February 6, 2026.

items.title: Analysis: Three Key Numbers Explain Bitcoin's Crash Below $70K
items.summary: Bitcoin's drop below $70,000 stems from high CME futures dominance (20-25% of global derivatives), 0.5 correlation with S&P 500 making it behave like a tech stock bet, and Wall Street's transformation of it into a tradable asset rather than decentralized money. Future scenarios include recovery to $85K-$90K, ranging $60K-$75K, or crash to $40K-$50K.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: REASON Framework Accelerates AI Reasoning 681-Fold
items.summary: Researchers developed REASON, a new computing framework that dramatically accelerates neuro-symbolic AI by optimizing probabilistic logical reasoning. The system completes end-to-end tasks in 0.8 seconds while consuming only 2.12W of power across 6 mm² of area.

items.title: Global IT Spending to Hit $6.15 Trillion in 2026, Driven by AI Infrastructure
items.summary: Gartner forecasts 10.8% growth in enterprise tech spending for 2026, with AI infrastructure leading the charge. Generative AI model spending is expected to grow 80.8%, reflecting how quickly GenAI is becoming essential across enterprise software.

items.title: Learning Commons Expands AI Education Partnerships
items.summary: Learning Commons is broadening its Knowledge Graph with new literacy and math partners to improve AI alignment with curriculum and learning science. The expansion aims to support teacher decision-making through standards-aligned, research-grounded AI tools.

items.title: Atlassian Demonstrates AI Cost Management Without Margin Erosion
items.summary: Atlassian assured investors it can scale AI features to five million Rovo seats while maintaining gross margins through operational optimization rather than price increases, suggesting SaaS companies can add AI affordably.

items.title: Industrial AI Adoption Accelerates Across Manufacturing and Automation
items.summary: AI integration in industrial sectors is increasing significantly, with large enterprises leading adoption. China dominance in robot installations continues with nearly 300,000 robots installed in 2024, while companies like Honeywell and KUKA leverage AI for predictive maintenance and motion optimization.

items.title: UN Establishes Independent Panel on AI Governance
items.summary: The United Nations has unveiled an independent panel on artificial intelligence, with the panel's first report expected to be published in time for the UN Global Dialogue on AI Governance in July.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Square Enix Releases Q3 2026 Earnings Report
items.summary: Square Enix announced its earnings results on February 6, 2026, providing key financial insights into the company's performance amid ongoing gaming industry developments.

items.title: GeForce NOW Celebrates 6-Year Anniversary with 25 February Games
items.summary: NVIDIA's GeForce NOW marks its sixth anniversary by adding 25 games in February 2026, including this week's highlights like Delta Force, PUBG: BLINDSPOT, and Indika, with several now streamable.

items.title: Amazon Prime Gaming Unveils February 2026 Lineup with 10 Free Games
items.summary: Amazon announced 10 free games for Prime members via Luna and other platforms in February 2026, starting with titles available from February 5 and rolling out weekly through the end of the month.

items.title: Valve Delays Steam Machine and Steam Frame Pricing Due to Component Shortages
items.summary: Valve confirmed that rising PC component costs, including RAM and SSD shortages, have delayed pricing and release date announcements for its 2026 Steam Machine console and VR headset, though a first-half launch remains planned.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Bethesda Announces Mixed Physical Release Strategy for Nintendo Switch 2 Games
items.summary: Bethesda revealed that Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition, Skyrim Anniversary Edition, and Oblivion Remastered will use code-in-box physical releases for Switch 2, while Indiana Jones and the Great Circle gets a full game cartridge. Releases are scheduled starting February 24 digitally for Fallout, with physicals in late April.

items.title: Tech Stocks Plunge as Wall Street Digests Massive Capital Spending Announcements
items.summary: US markets closed lower with Nasdaq dropping 1.6%, Dow 1.2%, and S&P 500 1.2%, driven by concerns over big tech's huge investments impacting profitability; Amazon shares fell 11% after hours on $200B capex plan.

items.title: Qualcomm Shares Sink 8.5% Despite Strong Quarterly Revenues
items.summary: Chipmaker Qualcomm experienced an 8.5% stock drop amid broader tech sector sell-off, even as it reported better-than-expected revenues.

items.title: REA Group Stock Drops 8% After Missing Earnings Expectations
items.summary: Australian real estate classifieds firm REA Group saw its shares fall 8% due to higher operational costs and disappointing half-year results.

items.title: Atlassian Shares Decline Despite Beating Revenue Forecasts
items.summary: Software company Atlassian stock fell despite exceeding revenue expectations and raising guidance, caught in the tech sector downturn.
